course_description: Curriculum related to human development and exceptional learners. Topics include cognitive development, memory, meta cognition, socioemotional development, mental health, sociocultural diversity, learning strategies and classroom management.
prerequisites: Notes: Open to students admitted to the Primary and Junio r (Aboriginal) program. this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_description: Introduction to the Social Studies curriculum for the Primary/Junior division. Conceptual foundations and instructional practices within the Ontario context.
prerequisites: Notes: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_description: Knowledge and skills necessary to be a successful Primary/Junior science teacher. Merging practice and theory (praxis) of school science fundamentals essential to 21st-century learning. Topics may include scientific literacy, creativity and science (inquiry), the nature of science, and integration with environmental education.
prerequisites: Notes: Open to students admitted to the Teacher Education Primary/Junior and Junior/Intermediate programs. this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_name: Practicum for Teaching in the Ontario Context
course_description: Connections between observation and experiences in field-based school placements to theory, practice and reflection. Previously learned in foundational method components and strategies of classroom and curriculum as related to the Ontario Curriculum and the Ontario College of Teachers Foundations of Professional Practice. Sessions divided between instructional methods and field experiences.
prerequisites: Notes: Open to students admitted to the Primary and Junio r (Aboriginal) program. this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_name: Professionalism & Law for Educator in Ontario
course_description: Professional and legal responsibilities of Ontario educators and schools examined through the study of statutes, regulations, professional codes of ethics and legal cases.
prerequisites: Notes: Open to students admitted to the Teacher Education Primary/Junior program. this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_description: Issues and perspective in special education and educational psychology. Elements of the Individual Education Plan, Universal Design for Learning and Differential Instruction examined in relation to programming in inclusive environments.
